Crunches = abs ?! ‼️🤔 We all do them...it is the most performed ab exercise all over the world, but are they really worth the effort? I’m going to keep it very simple 😉 ➖ 🤔Now before I give you my opinion, you need to understand that it doesn’t exist an exercise that burns the fat in your stomach, it just doesn’t work like that. If you want to see your abs you have to eliminate the fat that is covering them and you do that mostly by dieting on a calorie deficit (and some other factors). What abs exercises do is training your abdominal muscles, same as bench press does for chest, curls for biceps or squats for legs, but that’s it 🤷🏼‍♂️ ➖ ❓That being said, should you do crunches?! The answer is YES and NO. YES, because it’s an ab exercise and you don’t have to avoid it if you don’t want to; and NO, because there are tons of other abs exercises that are better than regular crunches: hanging leg raises, plank, reverse crunch, weighted decline

Should you do cardio while bulking? ‼️ Heavy weights and tons (literally) of food, that's bulking right?! 😂 But when it comes about cardio, there are some different opinions about doing it or so today I wanted to bring you mine. It depends on various factors, but for me these are crucial: 1️⃣ Are you worried about gaining too much fat or you don't care at all? If you do care, I suggest you to do cardio, since it is the kind of activity that activates slow torching fibers, which use fat as energy and will enable you to gain less fat. 2️⃣ Your schedule. This is completely up to you if you want to fit cardio into your daily routine or not. However, what I don't recommend you to do is to sacrifice rest time for doing cardio due to its importance for muscle growth. In this case I suggest you to reduce your calorie surplus and to do an active rest on your rest day, incorporating some cardio in that day Do you do cardio while bulking?! SHOULD YOU TAKE CREATINE?‼️/ DEBERÍAS TOMAR CREATINA? ‼️ Creatine is an organic acid that is produced as a consequence of the synthesis of 3 amino acids: arginine, glycine and methionine. It is the first source of energy of our body to face a physical effort. This first source is the ATP (adenosine triphosphate). Once creatine is released, it transfers its phosphate to the ADP (adenosine diphosphate) to start producing ATP, delaying muscle fatigue. How do we get creatine? By food and by its own internal production. So, should you take a creatine supplement? HELL YES! The reason why it's because you have to eat an excessive amount of food to get the quantity you need. Benefits: increases muscle strength and size, helps with recovery, improves brain function, helps muscle cells produce more energy, etc. My recommendation is to take 5gr of creatine monohydrate (the purest form of creatine) a day, it doesn't really matter when, just take it!! KNOW HOW TO CONTROL YOUR DIET‼️ As diet is the most complicated part to domain for the majority of people, here you have some tips 😉 1️⃣Know your calorie intake for maintenance: there is plenty of calculators on internet that make the numbers for you with different formulas, you can do it within 3 minutes. 2️⃣Select a goal: subtract or add 300/500 kcal to that number depending on your goal (fat loss/muscle growth). 3️⃣ Calculate your macros: 20/25 % of your DCI (daily calorie intake) should come from fats, so calculate the (for example) 20% of your DCI and divide it by 9 (1 gr fat =9kcal) 🥑 ➖ For protein, multiply your body weight (in lb) for 1,1 - 1,3. So to calculate how many calories that makes, multiply the number you get for 4 (1 gr protein = 4kcal)🍗 ➖ And finally, the rest should come from carbs, so divide all the calories left by 4 (1gr carbs = 4kcal)🍚 ➖➖➖➖➖ There you have it!! Physique update 🙌🏻😊 Started this mini maintenance phase at 67,3kg. Sitting on 67,1kg this morning. EAT ENOUGH PROTEIN// CONSUME SUFICIENTE PROTEÍNA ‼️‼️ While dieting, whether you are trying to gain muscle mass or lose fat, protein is crucial for successful results. Protein is the only macro that provides nitrogen to your organism. Nitrogen is a compound unique to protein that can provide a direct measure of ones amino acid (protein) status. Your body will only be in an anabolic state if your nitrogen balance is positive (which means you consume more protein than you excrete). Having a positive/negative nitrogen balance is what will determine if your are in an anabolic or catabolic state. How to keep it positive? Eat sufficient complete proteins, have enough rest and train in an anabolic fashion.
